page.title: 12FENWICK ARMS:Country Pub
page.content: Originally a farmhouse,then a transport cafe it then became a pub.The original building was stone.As well as being ex- tended in recent years it has been re- furbished inside and out to give it an old world pseudo-Tudor charm from the outside.It is a tied pub and restaurant owned by TetleyÂ£s Brewery and Cavalier restaurants who take all profits.Tetley set targets and pay the landlord bonus for increased trade.Tetleys pay bills thereby monitoring running costs.The pub comprises a bar,lounge,restaurant (split into 3 rooms)and private accomm- odation upstairs for the landlord.The clientele are mainly over 25yrs.It is difficult to cater for functions since the split rooms are too small.Allied Leisure pay rent to Tetley to have a fruit machine and a video installed. Dominoes is also played.In winter 6- weekly pub promoting fun nights occur
